item.title: The APPLY operator in SQL Server
item.description: The SQL Server APPLY operator is a powerful tool that can simplify complex queries, much like a delicious treat for your database code. It’s surprisingly common to discover useful features in SQL Server that you were previously unaware of. For instance, the APPLY operator would have been incredibly helpful in a scenario involving retrieving vendor addresses in Microsoft Dynamics GP. The task was to fetch both the primary and “remit to” addresses for each vendor.

item.title: Tip for SQL: How to search for special characters
item.description: While it’s challenging to stay updated on every post by Aubrey, the soon-to-be-renowned expert in GP, I came across a useful SQL tip I’d like to pass along. I seldom need to construct queries that involve searching for special characters like “_” or “%”. So, when I needed to locate all customer IDs starting with an underscore earlier today, I couldn’t recall the proper syntax. A quick online search provided numerous solutions, offering at least two straightforward methods for this type of query.
